column4: would that be the apt-get upgrade command someone told me not to do one day?
lol
why at boot screen do i have three different choices for Ubuntu.. really 6 but thats including safemode
- they are specific versions of the distro, dependant on processor architecture, etc...
- There would have been at least 2 to begin with.  I bet you have an AMD processor, because that is what the -K7 is for...
- LEAVE THEM!!!
ok i was just wondering if i added them somehow from installing different drivers...
i just get confused on what one i should boot.. i randomly pick them now
- The -386 is the base architecture for most modern processors.  The safe mode is obvious, and the -K7 would be there if you had an AMD processor.  Do you have an AMD processor?
yes
- What model?
Athlon XP i think it was called
- That is the earliest version of the AXP, but the -K7 version in your booter would have software optimized for that specific subset of architecture...
AXP?  Did i somehow put that -K7 version there?
- AXP is short for Athlon XP, and you might have done a kernel upgrade...
i think i did... so is there a better preference for me.. k7 or 386?
-  I just said, K7 is optimized for your processor, so that would make it the better choice...
yeah but having the earliest version threw me off thinking it wouldwork but have bugs since its older
thanks for the info :)
- You are welcome
